originalText.text: We had breakfast here every single day during our stay in NYC. The food was great and the service amazing - shout out to Rajmonda who was our waitress the whole time. We felt very welcomed üôåüèª

originalText.text: It was good atmosphere and the food is good until I found the servers hair under my egg and avocado sandwich. It was traumatizing for me to eat so I took it out and put that away and it on the floor but I should‚Äôve pick it up and put it on the plate so my mother won‚Äôt pay for that food because I wanna to eat peacefully and enjoy since I had a bad day yesterday and today because of food. I won‚Äôt eat that anymore and never come back. The serve think I‚Äôm lying and told me it‚Äôs men who‚Äôs cooking but I found serves has the same hair in my food. My mom and me had our hair tie and it‚Äôs black. We are Latina. The woman wear blonde and black long hair . So I don‚Äôt enjoy it but environment is nice. Enjoy your day.

originalText.text: Horrible coffee. Couldn‚Äôt finish my iced coffee because it just tasted so bad to me. Added a bunch of sugar and milk just to try and make it seem better but that didn‚Äôt even help. The food was rough too. Both my gf and I didn‚Äôt finish our meals (and I‚Äôm not one to not finish a meal) because it just wasn‚Äôt tasty. The food looked good for a photo but tasted bad! Bread was decent though but much better places to go to if you want fresh loaf of bread

originalText.text:
Can you believe this is the first time I have ever set foot inside a Le Pain Quotidien?  I am not sure why that is but I finally got a chance to sample their fare at one of their newest location in the upper west side.  This new location opened last month and is on the corner of 76th and Broadway which formerly was the home of Maison Kayser.

The space is beautiful, bright, and clean, with white marble counters and blond wood accents.  The baked goods are gorgeously presented in the glass case by the entrance.  The staff here are super friendly; was greeted as soon as I walked in and made to feel welcome.

I ordered the mixed berry tart and a raspberry rose macaron.  The tart was fantastic!  The berries tasted very fresh, the cream filling was so tasty, and it had a nice crust.  The macaron, surprisingly, was just alright.  Props for presentation but I wished it were fresher.  The bottom portion of the macaron was already soft from being in the case too long.  I can imagine this being a dynamite dessert when it is from a fresh batch, but I think I came too late in the day.

Prices are what you would expect for the UWS, so for me, it‚Äôs a little bit of a splurge but it doesn‚Äôt mean I won‚Äôt be back. On this visit, I opted for a couple of baked goods to go but made a mental note to try table service on my next visit.
